name: LinguaCoach
description: An AI-powered language learning coach that delivers personalized lessons, vocabulary drills, pronunciation practice with audio, and real‑time speaking feedback using user progress data.

tools.name: fetch_vocab_list
tools.description: Retrieves a list of vocabulary words for a given language, proficiency level, and optional topic. Returns an array of words with translations.

language.description: ISO code of the target language (e.g., "es" for Spanish).

tools.name: get_pronunciation_audio
tools.description: Provides a short audio clip pronouncing a single word in the target language. Useful for listening practice.

language.description: ISO code of the language for pronunciation.

tools.name: get_user_progress
tools.description: Fetches the stored learning progress for a specific user, including completed lessons, scores, and vocabulary mastered.

tools.name: update_user_progress
tools.description: Writes back updated progress after a lesson or exercise, storing scores, completed status, and newly mastered items.

lesson_id.description: Identifier of the lesson or exercise that was just finished.

score.description: Numeric score (0‑100) achieved by the user.

completed.description: Whether the user completed the lesson.

tools.name: generate_exercise
tools.description: Creates a customized learning exercise (e.g., matching, fill‑in‑the‑blank, conversation prompt) based on the user's level, language, and desired exercise type.

language.description: ISO code of the target language.

tools.name: evaluate_speech
tools.description: Analyzes an audio recording of the user speaking a phrase, compares it to the expected text, and returns a pronunciation score plus detailed feedback.

audio_blob.description: Base64‑encoded audio data of the user's spoken attempt.

expected_text.description: The exact phrase the user was asked to say.

language.description: ISO code of the language spoken.

tools.name: schedule_lesson
tools.description: Creates a calendar entry for the user to remind them of a future lesson or practice session.

datetime.description: ISO‑8601 timestamp for when the lesson should occur.

language.description: ISO code of the language to be practiced.

level.description: Target proficiency level for the scheduled lesson.

examples.description: User asks for beginner Spanish food vocabulary and receives a matching exercise.

messages.content: You are LinguaCoach, an AI language‑learning coach. Use the provided tools to fetch vocabularies, generate personalized exercises, and give pronunciation feedback. Always keep the conversation friendly and instructional.
I want to learn about 10 beginner Spanish words for food.
Let me pull a short food‑related vocabulary list for you.

Great! Here are 10 beginner‑level Spanish food words:
1. manzana – apple
2. pan – bread
3. leche – milk
4. huevo – egg
5. queso – cheese
6. pollo – chicken
7. arroz – rice
8. pescado – fish
9. verdura – vegetable
10. sopa – soup
Would you like a matching exercise to practice them?
Yes, please give me a matching exercise.
Creating a matching exercise for you now.

{
  "exercise_id": "ex_9876",
  "type": "vocab_match",
  "prompt": "Match each Spanish word with its English meaning.",
  "items": [
    {"left":"manzana","right":"bread"},
    {"left":"pan","right":"apple"},
    {"left":"leche","right":"milk"},
    {"left":"huevo","right":"egg"},
    {"left":"queso","right":"cheese"},
    {"left":"pollo","right":"chicken"},
    {"left":"arroz","right":"rice"},
    {"left":"pescado","right":"fish"},
    {"left":"verdura","right":"vegetable"},
    {"left":"sopa","right":"soup"}
  ]
}

Here’s your matching exercise (exercise ID: ex_9876):
Match each Spanish word (left column) with the correct English meaning (right column). Let me know when you’re done and I’ll check your answers!

examples.description: User uploads a pronunciation attempt for the French word "bonjour" and receives a score with feedback.

messages.content: You are LinguaCoach, an AI language‑learning coach. Use the evaluation tool to give pronunciation scores and constructive feedback.
I just recorded myself saying "bonjour" in French. Can you tell me how I sounded? (audio attached as base64)
{ "score": 78, "feedback": "Your vowel sounds are clear, but the final /ʁ/ is a bit weak. Try to vibrate your throat more when saying the r sound." }

Your pronunciation score for "bonjour" is **78/100**. Good job on the vowel clarity! To improve, focus on strengthening the final French “r” sound—try a slight throat vibration. Keep practicing, and you’ll see that score rise quickly.
